case.title: The " For companies" page should contain info for recruiters about the product
The " For companies" page should contain a comparison with other resources
The " For companies" page should contain quotes from the CEO
The " For companies" page should contain logos of partners.
The " For companies" page contains the [Hire Engineers] button.
The [Hire Engineers] button redirects the user to the Sign in/Sign Up page
The "For Engineers" page should contain link to Jobs
The "For Engineers" page should contain link to Web3 Companies
"For Engineers" page should contain login via "Google" icon
When the user clicks on login via the "Google" icon, the Google "OAuth Authorization" page is opened
"For Engineers" page should contain login via the "LinkedIn" icon
When the user clicks on login via the "LinkedIn" icon, the Instagram "OAuth Authorization page is opened
"For Engineers" page should contain login via "GitHub" icon
When the user clicks on login via the "GitHub" icon, the GitHub "OAuth Authorization" page is opened
The "For Engineers" page should contain "Email" field
When users enter a valid email in the "Email" field, they are redirected to the "Create account" page
The user can't be redirected to the "Create account " page without the At symbol (@) in the "Email" field
The user can't be redirected to the "Create account " page without the dot symbol (.) in the "Email" field
When the user enters an invalid email the validation message is appeared
The user can't be redirected to the "Create account " page without the username before the At symbol in the "Email" field
The user can be redirected to the "Create account " page with the subdomain in the "Email" field
The user can't be redirected to the "Create account " page without the domain in the "Email" field
The user can't be redirected to the "Create account " page with multiple @ symbols in the "Email" field
The user can't be redirected to the "Create account " page with unsupported symbols in the "Email" field ("!","#")
The user can't be redirected to the "Create account " page with an uppercase letter in the "Email" field
The user can't be redirected to the "Create account " page with SQL/script injection attempt in the "Email" field
The "For Engineers" page should contain [Get offers] button
When the users click on the [Get offers] button, they are redirected to the "Create account" page.
The "For Engineers" page should contain at least 10 feedback from real users at the bottom of the page
When not logged in user hovers over the filters section, the [Free Sign Up] button appears
When not logged in users click on [Free sign-up ] button, they are redirected to "Create an account" page
When not logged in user hover over the filters section the [Sign Up] button is appeared
When a not logged-in user hovers over the filters section, the [ Sign In] button appears
When not logged in users click on the [Sign-in] button, they are redirected to the "Sign In" page
When not logged in user clicks on the "Sign In" link, they are redirected to the "Sign In" form
The "Sign In" form should contain the "Email" required field
The "Sign In" form should contain a "Password" required field
The "Sign In" form should contain "Forgot password" link
The "Sign In" form should contain [Sign In] button
The "Sign In" form should contain "Sign Up" link
The user can sign in to filling all required fields
The user can sign in with valid credentials
The user can sign in by entering in the "Email" field already registered email
The user can't Sign In without the dot symbol (.) in the "Email" field
The user can't Sign In without the At symbol (@) in the "Email" field
When the user enters an invalid email in the "Email" field, the validation message appears
The user can't Sign In without the username before the 'at" symbol in the "Email" field
The user can sign in with the subdomain in the "Email" field
The user can't sign in without the domain in the "Email" field
The user can't Sign in with multiple @ symbols in the "Email" field
The user can't Sign in with empty "Email" field
The user can't Sign In with unsupported symbols in the "Email" field
The user can't sign in with an uppercase letter in the "Email" field
The user can't sign in with a SQL/script injection attempt in the "Email" field
The user can't sign in with long email (64+ characters before @) in the "Email" field
The user can't sign in with long domain (over 254 total characters) in the "Email" field
The user can sign in by entering in the "Password" field already registered password.
When the user enters an invalid password in the "Password" field, the validation message is appeared
The user can't sign in with empty "Password" field
The user can't sign in by entering the "Password" field to the maximum length (129-character password)
The user can't sign in by entering only letters in the "Password" field
The user can't sign in by entering only numbers in the "Password" field
The user can't sign in by entering only special symbols in the "Password" field
The user can sign in by entering at least one uppercase letter in the "Password" field
The user can sign in by entering at least one lowercase letter in the "Password" field
The user can sign in by entering at least one number in the "Password" field
The user can sign in by entering at least one special character in the "Password" field
The user can't sign in by entering SQL/script injection in the "Password" field
The "Password" field should contain visibility toggle
When the users enter all valid credentials and click on the [Sign In] button, they are redirected to the profile information page
When users click on the "Forgot password " link, they are redirected to the "Forgot password" page
When users click on the "Sign up" link, they are redirected to the "Create an account" page
When not logged in users click on "Sign up" link, they are redirected to " Create an account " form
The " Create an account" form should contain the "Email" required field
The " Create an account " form should contain the "Password" required field
The " Create an account" form should contain the "Repeat password" required field
The " Create an account form " form should contain "Sign Up via LinkedIn" link
The " Create an account form " form should contain "Sign Up via Google" link
The " Create an account form " form should contain "Sign Up via GitHub" link
The " Create an account form " form should contain [Create an account] button
The users can sign up with valid email credentials
The user can't sign up without the dot symbol (.) in the "Email" field
The user can't sign up without the At symbol (@) in the "Email" field
When the user enters an invalid email in the "Email" field, the validation message appears
The user can't sign up without the username before the 'at" symbol in the "Email" field
The user can sign up with the subdomain in the "Email" field
The user can't sign up without the domain in the "Email" field
The user can't sign up with multiple @ symbols in the "Email" field
The user can't sign up with an empty "Email" field
The user can't sign up with unsupported symbols in the "Email" field (#, $, %, ^, *, =, <, >, {}, [], |, \, /)
The user can't sign up with a SQL/script injection attempt in the "Email" field
The user can't sign up with a long email (64+ characters before @) in the "Email" field
The user can't sign up with a long domain (over 254 total characters) in the "Email" field
The user can't sign up with Non-Latin letters in the "Email" field
The users can sign up with valid password credentials
The user can't sign up with an empty "Password" field
The user can't sign up by entering the "Password" field to the maximum length (129-character password)
The user can't sign up by entering only letters in the "Password" field
The user can't sign up by entering only numbers in the "Password" field
The user can't sign up by entering only special symbols in the "Password" field
The user can sign up by entering at least one uppercase letter in the "Password" field
The user can sign up by entering at least one lowercase letter in the "Password" field
The user can sign up by entering at least one number in the "Password" field
The user can sign up by entering at least one special character in the "Password" field
The user can't sign up by entering SQL/script injection in the "Password" field
The "Password" field should contain visibility toggle
When the user clicks on the password visibility toggle, the password characters become visible, and when toggling again, are hidden in the "Password" field
The user can't sign up by entering one character in the "Password" field
When the user clicks on sign up via the "Google" icon, the LinkedIn "OAuth Authorization" page is opened
When the user clicks on sign up via the "LinkedIn" icon, the LinkedIn "OAuth Authorization" page is opened
When the user clicks on sign up via the "GitHub" icon, the GitHub "OAuth Authorization" page is opened
When the user clicks on the [Create account] button, are redirected to the " I am a candidate/a recruiter" page
Web3 companies and Jobs should contain a table with 100 web3 companies split by 10, like 10/100; N/100; 100/100
Each company should have a clickable logo on the "Web3 companies and Jobs" page
When user click on the logo open a page in a new tab with a list of vacancies for this company
Each company should have a clickable name on the "Web3 companies and Jobs" page
When user click on the name open a page in a new tab with a list of vacancies for this company

section.name: Table with 100 web3 companies split by 10
Page with a list of vacancies

case.title: Unauthorized users should not be able to post a new job
When Unauthorized users click on the [View more] button, the pop-up "Let's create an account" appeared
Unauthorized users should not be able to applying with 1 click to job

section.name: User logged in as a candidate

case.title: Authorized users should have a [Download in the App Store] button
When authorized users click on the [Download in the App Store] button, the Apple Store page is opened
Authorized users should have a [Get in on Google Pay] button
When authorized users click on the [Get in on Google Pay] button, the Google Play Store page is opened
When a user signs in as a candidate, the "Candidates form" stays available
The "Candidates" form should contain “Role” field
The "Candidates" form should contain "Technologies" field
The "Candidates" form should contain "Desired base salary" field
The "Candidates" form should contain [Annual] button
The "Candidates" form should contain [Monthly] button
The "Candidates" form should contain “English level” field
The "Candidates" form should contain “Candidate's location” field
The "Candidates" form should contain [Time zone] button
The "Candidates" form should contain [Country\City ] button
The “Role” field contain roles dropdown
The “Technologies” field contain technologies dropdown
The “English level” field contain levels dropdown
When the user clicks on the [Country\City ] button, the "Select city or country" field appears
The list of candidates should look like a list of cards with info about a candidate.
The candidate's card should contain a description of the candidate's skills
The candidate's card should contain a description of the candidate's achievements
When the user click on [Show experience] button should open all candidate’s experiences
When the user with Candidate's permission clicks on the [Start chat] button, they are redirected to the "Create recruiter profile" pop-up
When the user clicking on the candidate’s card, the candidate’s profile should be opened in a new tab
The candidate’s profile should contain all information about the candidate
The contacts with the candidate should be hidden in the candidate's card
The candidate’s contact information should be available after the chat with the candidate
Candidate’s experience should be sorted from the oldest to the newest positions
When user choose sign up like a candidates, they are redirected to "Profile information" page
The "Profile information" page contain " Role" stage
The "Role" stage contains required the “Desired position” field
The “Desired position” field contain "Example: "Senior Java Engineer" placeholder
The "Role" stage should contain required the “Core technical skills” field
The user should choose at least 5 skills in the “Core technical skills” field
The user should choose a maximum of 15 skills in the “Core technical skills” field
When the user chooses 2 skills, the validation message appears " Select at least 5 skills"
When the user chooses more than 15 skills, the validation message appears " Max number of core skills is selected."
The "Role" stage should contains [Save and continue] button
The "Profile information" page contain "Expectation" stage
The "Expectation" stage should contain require the "Desired base salary, $ " field
The " Desired base salary, $" field should accept numerical characters
The "Desired base salary, $" field should not accept alphabetical characters
The "Desired base salary, $" field should not accept contain special symbols
The "Desired base salary, $" field should not be empty
The "Expectation" stage should contain [€] button
The " Desired base salary, $ " should contain [Annual] button
The user should choose a maximum of 216 000 $ in the "Desired base salary, $" when clicking on the [Annual] button
The user should choose at least 2400 $ per year in the "Desired base salary, $" when clicking on the [Annual] button
When the user inputs 1500 $, the validation message appears "Minimum salary is $2400/year"
When the user inputs 300,000 $, the validation message appears "Maximum salary is $216 000"
The " Desired base salary, $ " should contain [Monthly] button
The user should choose a maximum of 18 000 $ in the "Desired base salary, $" when clicking on the [Monthly] button
The user should choose at least 200 $ per month in the "Desired base salary, $" when clicking on the [Monthly] button
When user input 20 000 $, the validation message appears "Maximum salary is $18 000"
When user input 100 $, the validation message appears "Minimum salary is $200/month"
The "Expectation" stage should contain require the “Job experience” dropdown
The "Expectation" stage should contain require the “English level” dropdown
The "Expectation" stage should contain “You location” field
When the user starts typing in the "Your location" field, the dropdown suggestions appear
The "Expectation" stage should contain [Save and continue] button
The "Profile information" page should contain " Experience" stage
The " Experience" stage should contain [Upload from LinkedIn] button
When the user clicks on the [Upload from LinkedIn] button, the “Link to my LinkedIn profile” URL field appears
The “Link to my LinkedIn profile” URL field should not accept non-LinkedIn URL
The “Link to my LinkedIn profile” URL field should not accept Invalid domain
The “Link to my LinkedIn profile” URL field should not accept random text
The “Link to my LinkedIn profile” URL field should not accept leading and trailing spaces
The “Link to my LinkedIn profile” URL field should not accept very long URL (> 2000 chars)
The “Link to my LinkedIn profile” URL field should not accept special characters in the username
The “Link to my LinkedIn profile” URL field should not accept upper-case letters
The “Link to my LinkedIn profile” URL field should accept valid LinkedIn profile URL
The " Experience" stage should contain [Import experience] button
The " Experience" stage should contain [Cancel] button
The " Experience" stage should contain the [Add manually] button
When user click on [Add manually] button, the "Experience" form is appear
The "Experience" form should contain required “Role” field
The “Role” field should accept valid position text
The “Role” field should not accept a minimum length of 1 character.
The “Role” field should not accept only number
The “Role” field should not accept special characters only
The “Role” field should not accept mixed-case letters
The “Role” field should not be empty field
The "Experience" form should contain the required “Company name” field
The “Company name” field should accept valid text
The “Company name” field should not be an empty field
The “Company name” field should accept at least 2 characters
The “Company name” field should not accept only numbers
The “Company name” field should accept alphanumeric characters
The “Company name” field should not accept invalid symbols
The “Company name” field should accept special characters like (&, -, .)
When the user input invalid credential in the “Company name” field, validation message is appeared
The "Experience" form should contain the required “Month” dropdown
The "Experience" form should contain the required “Year” field
The “Year” field should accept only numerical characters
The “Year” field should not accept alphabetical characters
The “Year” field should not accept special symbols
The “Year” field should not be empty
The “Year” field should accept 4 characters
The “Year” field should not accept 1 character
The “Year” field should accept 7 characters
When the user inputs invalid credentials in the “Year” field, a validation message appears: "Please enter a correct year."
The "Experience" form should contain the [I am working here] button
The "Experience" form should contain the [End day] button
The "Experience" form should contain the [Save] button
The "Experience" form should contain the [Cancel] button
The "Experience" form should contain the [Save and continue] button
When user click on [Save and continue] button they redirected to the "Bio" page
The "Bio" page should contain required “Achievements” field
The "Bio" page should contain optional the “Expectations from the work” field
The "Bio" page should contain the [Save and continue] button
The “Achievements” field should accept alphanumeric characters
The “Achievements” field should not accept only special symbols
The “Achievements” field should not accept only numbers
The “Achievements” field should accept at least 2 characters
The “Achievements” field should not be empty
The “Expectations from the work” field should accept alphanumeric characters
The “Expectations from the work” field should not accept only special symbols
The “Expectations from the work” should not accept only numbers
The “Expectations from the work” field should accept at least 2 characters
When user click on [Save and continue] button they redirected to the "Contact information "page
“Contact information” page should contain "First name" required field
“Contact information” page should contain “Last name” field required field
The “First name” field should accept a valid user's name input
The “First name” field should not be empty
The “First name” field should not accept only numbers
The “First name” field should not accept special symbols
When the user inputs invalid credentials in the “First name” field, a validation message appears: "Please enter a correct First name."
The “Last name” field should accept a valid user's name input
The “Last name” field should not be empty
The “Last name” field should not accept only numbers
The “Last name” field should not accept special symbols
When the user inputs invalid credentials in the “Last name” field, a validation message appears: "Please enter a correct last name."
“Contact information” page should contain users avatar
“Contact information” page contains an optional “Behance” URL field
The “Behance” field URL field should not accept a non-Behance URL
The “Behance” field URL field should not accept random text
The “Behance” URL field should accept a valid Behance profile URL
“Contact information” page contains an optional “GitHub” URL field
The “GitHub ” URL field should not accept a non-GitHub URL
The “GitHub ” URL field should not accept random text
The “GitHub ” URL field should accept a valid GitHub profile URL
“Contact information” page contains an optional “LinkedIn” URL field
The “ LinkedIn ” URL field should not accept non-LinkedIn URL
The “ LinkedIn ” URL field should not accept random text
The “ LinkedIn ” URL field should accept a valid LinkedIn profile URL
The "CV file/PDF" field accept only PDF format file
The "CV file/PDF" field accepts only 1 file
The "CV file/PDF" field should not accept 3 files
The "CV file/PDF" field should not accept a file with the wrong format (.jpeg, .docx ..)
The "CV file/PDF" field should accepts file size within a limit (e.g. < 5 MB)
The "CV file/PDF" field should not accept a file size of 10MB
When the user clicks on the [Save and continue] button, they are redirected to the "Profile" page
The candidate should be able to open their contacts or decline the recruiter’s proposition and not share contact details
The "Chat" page contain [All] button
The "Chat" page contains [Archive] button
The candidates should be able to mark chat as a favourite by clicking on the [Favourite] button
The “User profile” link should contain “Edit profile” button
When the user click on the “Edit profile” button, they are redirected to "Edit profile" page
The “User profile” link should contain a [Switch to recruiter profile]" button
The “User profile” link should contain a [Connect via LinkedIn] button
When the user clicks on the [Connect via Google] button, the Google "OAuth Authorization" page is opened

When the user clicks on [Connect via GitHub], the GitHub "OAuth Authorization" page is opened
The “User profile” link should contain a [Connect via Google] button
When the user clicks on the [Connect via Google] button, the Google "OAuth Authorization" page is opened
The “User profile” link should contain a [Change password] button
The “User profile” link should contain a [Deactivate profile] button when profile is activate
The “User profile” link should contain a [Activate profile] button when profile is deactivate
For sign in users as a recruiter is available [Post a job] dropdown on the " Web3 companies and Jobs" page
The [Post a job] dropdown contain “Post a new job manually” link
The [Post a job] dropdown contains the “ Import from ATS” link
Authorized users should be able to applying to job with 1 click
The users should be able to filter vacancies by skills
The users should be able to subscribe to vacancies at the bottom of the "Web3 companies and Jobs"
“Desired roles” field should contain a roles dropdown
“Experience” field should contain an experience dropdown
The users should input valid email credentials
The user should not input credentials without the dot symbol (.) in the "Email" field
The user should not input credentials without the At symbol (@) in the "Email" field
The user should not input credentials without the domain in the "Email" field
The "Email" field should not be empty
“Subscribe to the vacancies” form should contain “Email” field
When the user clicks on the [Receive job] button, the message appears "Subscription created. We will notify you by email about new jobs."
